title: Whom will Republicans run in 2012?

content: Somebody we've never heard of yet, or just heard of briefly much in the same way that former Senator Obama wasn't a household word. Having said that I remember "then" Senator Obama's speech at the Democratic National Convention in 2004, and right away had a gut feeling that "young man" was going places! Palin, Jindal, Steele, etc, all seem to be stuck in the same old mold of 2008. I don't see any new agendas with them, as they seem to be stuck on stop. Oh yea there's the Governor of Minnesota whose name escapes me at the moment, but he's in his 40's, very active, and people in that state seem to like him quite a bit. General Petraeus is a name I hear people tossing around, but something tells me the good General just wants to retire and stay out of the political fray. I truly believe the era of "former military" running for election, is a by gone era at that. And with all due respect JDK, I think Newt has been neutered. He's a has been, been there done that, JMO. But who knows, this is America, and literally speaking, anything can happen! As for Jeb Bush, well, lets just say most folks are just plain Bush-wacked....... Okay, just did an internet search, and it's Tim Pawlenty who is the current Governor of Minnesota. As of right now, my bet is he'll get the call. No one starts a war--or rather, no one in his senses ought to do so--without first being clear in his mind what he intends to achieve by that war and how he intends to conduct it. Carl von Clausewitz

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: Powell or Rice or Jindal . . . I can't see a Caucasian, man or woman having much of a chance until the novelty wears off - - Ghost, I just don't see race as a factor anymore, but perhaps I'm being too progressive. With Powell having voted for Obama, an his age (shouldn't be a factor but sometimes it is) I just don't see him in the race. Condie is single and doesn't have her own family, and Republicans always are looking toward "family values." From what little I do know about Tim Pawlenty, he tends to shy away from mainsteam Republicanism, and perhaps that's why he's known as a good governor, because he always talks in the best interest of his state. I don't know his track record, but like Mr. Obama, he's got some excellent skills in verbiage, and must be doing something right for Minn. We'll see, should get interesting to say the least. title: Whom will Republicans run in 2012?

content: Somebody we've never heard of yet, or just heard of briefly much in the same way that former Senator Obama wasn't a household word. Having said that I remember "then" Senator Obama's speech at the Democratic National Convention in 2004, and right away had a gut feeling that "young man" was going places! Palin, Jindal, Steele, etc, all seem to be stuck in the same old mold of 2008. I don't see any new agendas with them, as they seem to be stuck on stop. Oh yea there's the Governor of Minnesota whose name escapes me at the moment, but he's in his 40's, very active, and people in that state seem to like him quite a bit. General Petraeus is a name I hear people tossing around, but something tells me the good General just wants to retire and stay out of the political fray. I truly believe the era of "former military" running for election, is a by gone era at that. And with all due respect JDK, I think Newt has been neutered. He's a has been, been there done that, JMO. But who knows, this is America, and literally speaking, anything can happen! As for Jeb Bush, well, lets just say most folks are just plain Bush-wacked....... Okay, just did an internet search, and it's Tim Pawlenty who is the current Governor of Minnesota. As of right now, my bet is he'll get the call. No one starts a war--or rather, no one in his senses ought to do so--without first being clear in his mind what he intends to achieve by that war and how he intends to conduct it. Carl von Clausewitz

content: Somebody we've never heard of yet, or just heard of briefly much in the same way that former Senator Obama wasn't a household word. Having said that I remember "then" Senator Obama's speech at the Democratic National Convention in 2004, and right away had a gut feeling that "young man" was going places! Palin, Jindal, Steele, etc, all seem to be stuck in the same old mold of 2008. I don't see any new agendas with them, as they seem to be stuck on stop. Oh yea there's the Governor of Minnesota whose name escapes me at the moment, but he's in his 40's, very active, and people in that state seem to like him quite a bit. General Petraeus is a name I hear people tossing around, but something tells me the good General just wants to retire and stay out of the political fray. I truly believe the era of "former military" running for election, is a by gone era at that. And with all due respect JDK, I think Newt has been neutered. He's a has been, been there done that, JMO. But who knows, this is America, and literally speaking, anything can happen! As for Jeb Bush, well, lets just say most folks are just plain Bush-wacked....... Okay, just did an internet search, and it's Tim Pawlenty who is the current Governor of Minnesota. As of right now, my bet is he'll get the call. No one starts a war--or rather, no one in his senses ought to do so--without first being clear in his mind what he intends to achieve by that war and how he intends to conduct it. Carl von Clausewitz
